sen.j: 足利 義澄（あしかが よしずみ）は、室町幕府の第11代征夷大将軍（在位：明応2年（1493年） - 永正8年（1508年）。
sen.e: Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA is the 11th Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi Shogunate (held the position from Year1493 to Year 1508).
Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA is the 11th Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi Shogunate (held the position from 1493 to 1508).
Yoshizumi ASHIKAGA is the 11th Seii Taishogun of the Muromachi Shogunate (held the position from 1493 to 1508).

sen.j: 父は8代将軍足利義政の弟である堀越公方足利政知。
sen.e: His father is Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the Horikoshi Kubo, a younger brother of the 8th Shogun, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
His father is Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the Horikoshi Kubo, a younger brother of the 8th Shogun, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
His father is Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the Horikoshi Kubo, a younger brother of the 8th Shogun, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 母は権大納言・武者小路隆光の娘。
sen.e: His mother is the daughter of Takamitsu MUSYANOKOJI, the Gondainagon.
sen.cmt: 武者小路隆光の表記は確認とれず
sen.e: His mother is the daughter of Takamitsu MUSYANOKOJI, the Gondainagon.
His mother is the daughter of Takamitsu MUSYANOKOJI, the Gondainagon.

sen.j: 出家名は清晃、還俗して義遐、義高、そして義澄。
sen.e: His name as a priest was Seiko, and after he returned to secular life, was named Yoshito, then Yoshitaka, and finally Yoshizumi.
sen.cmt: 義高の表記は確認とれず
sen.e: His name as a priest was Seiko, and after he returned to secular life, was named Yoshito, then Yoshitaka, and finally Yoshizumi.
His name as a priest was Seiko, and after he returned to secular life, was named Yoshito, then Yoshitaka, and finally Yoshizumi.

sen.j: 義政の養子となる。
sen.e: Became an adopted son of Yoshimasa.
He became an adopted son of Yoshimasa.
He became an adopted son of Yoshimasa.

sen.j: 正室は日野永俊の娘・安養院。
sen.e: His official wife is Anyouin, the daughter of Nagatoshi HINO.
sen.cmt: いずれも表記確認とれず
sen.e: His official wife is Anyouin, the daughter of Nagatoshi HINO.
His official wife is Anyou-in Temple, the daughter of Nagatoshi HINO.

sen.j: 子に足利義晴と足利義維がいる。
sen.e: Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA are his children.
Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA are his children.
Yoshiharu ASHIKAGA and Yoshitsuna ASHIKAGA are his children.

sen.j: 明応2年（1493年）に10代将軍足利義稙（足利義稙）が細川政元によって追放されると、11代将軍として擁立された。
sen.e: When Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the 10th Shogun, was banished by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Yoshizumi was supported to become the 11th Shogun.
When Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the 10th Shogun, was banished by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Yoshizumi was favored to become the 11th Shogun.
When Yoshitane ASHIKAGA, the 10th Shogun, was banished by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, Yoshizumi was favored to become the 11th Shogun.

sen.j: しかし、永正5年（1508年）に前将軍義稙を擁立する大内義興が上洛の軍を起こしたため、近江国へ逃れて将軍職を廃され、復帰できないまま死去した。
sen.e: However, when Yoshioki OUCHI, who supported the previous Shogun Yoshitane, raised an army in Year 1508 to advance to Kyoto, Yoshizumi fled to Oumi province, and was removed from the position as the Shogun, and died without returning to the position.

However, when Yoshioki OUCHI, a supporter of the previous Shogun Yoshitane, raised an army in 1508 to advance to Kyoto, Yoshizumi fled to Oumi Province and was removed from the position as the Shogun; he died without returning to the position [of Shogun].

However, when Yoshioki OUCHI, a supporter of the previous Shogun Yoshitane, raised an army in 1508 to advance to Kyoto, Yoshizumi fled to Oumi Province and was removed from the position as the Shogun; he died without returning to the position [of Shogun].

sen.j: 文明12年（1480年）12月15日、堀越公方足利政知の子として生まれる。
sen.e: Born on December 15, 1480 as the child of Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the Horikoshi Kubo.
He was born on December 15, 1480 as a child of Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the Horikoshi Kubo.
He was born on December 15, 1480 as a child of Masatomo ASHIKAGA, the Horikoshi Kubo.

sen.j: はじめ天竜寺で僧となるが、やがてで伯父・足利義政の養子となった。
sen.e: Initially became a priest in Tenryu-ji temple, but later became an adopted son of his uncle, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
He initially became a priest at Tenryu-ji temple, but later became an adopted son of his uncle, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.
Initially became a priest in Tenryu-ji Temple, but later became an adopted son of his uncle, Yoshimasa ASHIKAGA.

sen.j: 明応2年（1493年）の明応の政変で10代将軍足利義稙（義稙）を追放した管領細川政元や日野富子らによって擁立され、11代将軍に就任する。
sen.e: Supported by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, the Kanrei, and Tomiko HINO who banished Yoshitane ASHIKAGA (Yoshitane), the 10th Shogun, in Meio Coup in Year 1493, became the 11th Shogun.
He was favored to become the next Shogun by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, the Kanrei, and Tomiko HINO who banished Yoshitane ASHIKAGA (Yoshitane) in Meio Coup of 1493; he was installed as the 11th Shogun.
sen.cmt: Reworded. 明応の政変、裏づけとれず
sen.e: He was favored to become the next Shogun by Masamoto HOSOKAWA, the Kanrei, and Tomiko HINO who banished Yoshitane ASHIKAGA (Yoshitane) in Meio Coup of 1493; he was installed as the 11th Shogun.

sen.j: しかし、実権は細川政元や日野富子らに握られていた。
sen.e: However, actual power was held by such people as Masamoto HOSOKAWA and Tomiko HINO.
However, the actual power was held by people such as Masamoto HOSOKAWA and Tomiko HINO.
However, the actual power was held by people such as Masamoto HOSOKAWA and Tomiko HINO.

sen.j: 永正4年（1507年）に政元が暗殺され細川氏（京兆家）の家督をめぐる内訌が生じ（永正の錯乱）、翌永正5年（1508年）4月、前将軍義尹（義材より改名）を擁立する大内軍が上洛してくるとの報により、近江の六角高頼を頼って朽木谷、さらに蒲生郡岡山に逃れた。
sen.e: When, in Year 1507 Masamoto was assassinated and internal dispute regarding who will be the heir to HOSOKAWA family (KEICHO family) occurred, and in Year 1508 when the news arrived that OUCHI army who is supporting Yoshitada (changed name from Yoshiki) is coming to Kyoto, Yoshizumi escaped to Oumi to seek support of Takayori ROKKAKU, and further escaped to Okayama Gamou-gun.

After Masamoto was assassinated in 1507 an internal dispute regarding the HOSOKAWA (KEICHO) family's heir (Eisho Trouble) erupted; in April of the following year, 1508, upon hearing that the OUCHI army supporting the former Shogun Yoshitada (formerly named Yoshiki) was advancing to Kyoto Yoshizumi escaped to Kuchikidani seeking support from Takayori ROKKAKU of Oumi, and he escaped further to Okayama in Gamou-gun.
sen.cmt: Rewoded. 永正の錯乱、確認とれずセル13、20に足利義稙（義稙）という記述があるが、この義稙と、義尹、義材は同一人物。かっこ内は義尹か義材のどちらかの名前が入るのではないか。http://www.lit.kobe-u.ac.jp/~area-c/tomatu/asikaga.html
sen.e: After Masamoto was assassinated in 1507 an internal dispute regarding the HOSOKAWA (KEICHO) family's heir (Eisho Trouble) erupted; in April of the following year, 1508, upon hearing that the OUCHI army supporting the former Shogun Yoshitada (formerly named Yoshiki) was advancing to Kyoto Yoshizumi escaped to Kuchikidani seeking support from Takayori ROKKAKU of Oumi, and he escaped further to Okayama in Gamou-gun.

sen.j: 7月、義澄は将軍を廃され、義稙（義尹より改名）が将軍に返り咲いた。
sen.e: In July, Yoshizumi was removed from the position as the Shogun, and Yoshitane (changed name from Yoshitada) returned to the position as the Shogun.
In July, Yoshizumi was removed from the position as the Shogun, and Yoshitane (formerly named Yoshitada) returned to the position as the Shogun.
In July, Yoshizumi was removed from the position as the Shogun, and Yoshitane (formerly named Yoshitada) returned to the position as the Shogun.

sen.j: その後、再び勢力を盛り返そうとして細川澄元、三好之長・三好長秀親子を京都に侵攻させるなどしたが、そのたびに細川高国・大内義興らに敗れた。
sen.e: Subsequently, trying to regain power, he let Sumimoto HOSOKAWA and Yukinaga & Nagahide MIYOSHI (father and son) invade Kyoto, but they were defeated each time by Takakuni HOSOKAWA, Yoshioki OUCHI, etc.

He later tried to regain power by having Sumimoto HOSOKAWA and the faterh-and-son team Yukinaga and Nagahide MIYOSHI to invade Kyoto, but they were defeated each time by Takakuni HOSOKAWA and Yoshioki OUCHI.

He later tried to regain power by having Sumimoto HOSOKAWA and the faterh-and-son team Yukinaga and Nagahide MIYOSHI to invade Kyoto, but they were defeated each time by Takakuni HOSOKAWA and Yoshioki OUCHI.

sen.j: また、義稙の暗殺を謀ったりもしたが失敗している。
sen.e: He also planned to assasinate Yoshitane, but failed.
He also plotted an assasination of Yoshitane, but he failed.
He also plotted an assasination of Yoshitane, but he failed.

sen.j: 永正7年（1510年）には義稙の命を受けた高国・義興らの近江侵攻を受けるが、近江国人衆を糾合した軍勢でもって勝利した。
sen.e: In Year 1590, Oumi province was invaded by Takakuni, Yoshioki and others, who were ordered by Yoshitane, but Yoshizumi won with the army formed by warriors of Oumi province.
By the order of Yoshitane Oumi Province was invaded by Takakuni, Yoshioki and others in 1510, but Yoshizumi won with the army formed by warriors of Oumi Province.
By the order of Yoshitane Oumi Province was invaded by Takakuni, Yoshioki and others in 1510, but Yoshizumi won with the army formed by warriors of Oumi Province.

sen.j: さらに豊後国の大友親治や播磨国の赤松義村らに援助を求める御内書を送るなどして、将軍復帰を目指した。
sen.e: He further tried to return to the position as the Shogun, by making such efforts as sending private letters to Chikaharu OTOMO of Bungo province and Yoshimura AKAMATSU of Harima Province.
He made further attempts to reinstate himself as the Shogun by sending private letters to Chikaharu OTOMO of Bungo Province and Yoshimura AKAMATSU of Harima Province.
He made further attempts to reinstate himself as the Shogun by sending private letters to Chikaharu OTOMO of Bungo Province and Yoshimura AKAMATSU of Harima Province.

sen.j: しかし、永正8年（1511年）8月14日、義稙・高国・義興との決戦（船岡山の戦い）直前に近江国岡山で病死した。
sen.e: However, on August 14 1511, he died of an illness in Okayama, Oumi province, immediately before the final battle (Funaokayama Battle) with Yoshitane, Takakuni and Yoshioki.
However, on August 14, 1511, he died of an illness in Okayama, Oumi Province just before the final battle with Yoshitane, Takakuni and Yoshioki (Funaokayama Battle).
However, on August 14, 1511, he died of an illness in Okayama, Oumi Province just before the final battle with Yoshitane, Takakuni and Yoshioki (Funaokayama Battle).

sen.j: 享年32。
sen.e: He died at the age of 32.
He died at the age of 32.
He died at the age of 32.

sen.j: 肖像は京都市北区の等持院（木像）。
sen.e: There is a portrait (wooden statue) of Yoshizumi in Toji-in temple of Kita-ku, Kyoto city.
There is a portrait (wooden statue) of Yoshizumi in Toji-in temple of Kita-ku, Kyoto city.
There is a portrait (wooden statue) of Yoshizumi in Toji-in Temple of Kita-ku, Kyoto city.

tit.e: History of Government Posts and Court Ranks and Honors awarded
History of Government Posts and Court Ranks and Honors awarded
History of Government Posts and Court Ranks and Honors awarded

sen.j: ※日付＝旧暦
sen.e: *Dates=Lunar Calendar
*Dates=Lunar Calendar
*Dates=Lunar Calendar

sen.j: 1493年（明応2年）4月28日、従五位下に叙す。
sen.e: On April 28 1493 was created Jyu Goi-ge.
He was given the court rank of Jyu Goi-ge on April 28, 1493.
He was given the court rank of Jyu Goi-ge on April 28, 1493.

sen.j: 時に、義遐を名乗る（6月に義高と改名）。
sen.e: Named himselfYoshitou (changed the name to Yoshitaka in June).
He used the name Yoshitou at the time (he changed his name to Yoshitaka in June).
He used the name Yoshitou at the time (he changed his name to Yoshitaka in June).

sen.j: 1494年（明応3年）11月24日、正五位下に叙し、左馬頭に任官。
sen.e: On November 24 1494 was created Sho Goi-ge and appointed as Samanokami.
On November 24, 1494, he was given the court rank of Sho Goi-ge and was appointed to the post of Samanokami.
On November 24, 1494, he was given the court rank of Sho Goi-ge and was appointed to the post of Samanokami.

sen.j: 12月27日、征夷大将軍宣下。
sen.e: On December 27, was appointed as Seii Taishogun by the Emperor.
On December 27, was appointed as Seii Taishogun by the Emperor.
On December 27, was appointed as Seii Taishogun by the Emperor.

sen.j: 1502年（文亀2年）7月12日、従四位下に昇叙し、参議に補任。
sen.e: On July 12 1502, court rank advanced to Jyu Shii-ge, and was apointed to the post of Sangi.
On July 12, 1502, his court rank advanced to Jyu Shii-ge, and he was appointed to the post of Sangi.
On July 12, 1502, his court rank advanced to Jyu Shii-ge, and he was appointed to the post of Sangi.

sen.j: 左近衛中将を兼任。
sen.e: Concurrently assumed the position of Sakonoechujyo.
He also held the position of Sakonoechujyo.
He also held the position of Sakonoechujyo.

sen.j: 7月21日、名を義澄と改める。
sen.e: On July 21, changed name to Yoshizumi.
On July 21, he changed his name to Yoshizumi.
On July 21, he changed his name to Yoshizumi.

sen.j: 1503年（文亀3年）1月14日、従三位に昇叙。
sen.e: On January 14 1503, court rank advanced to Jyu Sanmi.
On January 14, 1503, his court rank advanced to Jyu Sanmi.
On January 14, 1503, his court rank advanced to Jyu Sanmi.

sen.j: 参議及び左近衛中将如元。
sen.e: Assigned as Sangi and Sakonoechujyo.
sen.cmt: 如元の意味を辞書で確認したかったが、辞書には載っていない。
sen.e: His appointment to Sangi and Sakonoechujyo remained unchanged [eventhough his court rank was advanced].
His appointment to Sangi and Sakonoechujyo remained unchanged [eventhough his court rank was advanced].

sen.j: 1508年（永正5年）4月16日、征夷大将軍参議左近衛中将等辞職。
sen.e: On April 16 1508, resigned from the position of Seii Taishogun, Sangi, Sakonoechujyo.
On April 16, 1508, he resigned from his positions of Seii Taishogun, Sangi and Sakonoechujyo.
On April 16, 1508, he resigned from his positions of Seii Taishogun, Sangi and Sakonoechujyo.

sen.j: 1511年（永正8年）8月14日、薨去
sen.e: Died on August 14 1511.
He died on August 14, 1511.
He died on August 14, 1511.

sen.j: 1521年（永正18年）8月12日、贈従一位左大臣
sen.e: On August 12 1521, was awarded the rank of Jyu Ichii, Sadaijin.
On August 12, 1521, he was [posthumously] awarded the rank of Jyu Ichii, Sadaijin.
On August 12, 1521, he was [posthumously] awarded the rank of Jyu Ichii, Sadaijin.

sen.j: 1533年（天文 (元号)2年）9月12日、追贈太政大臣
sen.e: On September 12 1533, was further awarded the rank of Daijyodaijin.
On September 12, 1533, he was further awarded the rank of Daijyodaijin.
On September 12, 1533, he was further awarded the rank of Daijyodaijin.

tit.e: People given a kanji character from Yoshizumi's name in their names.
People given a kanji character from Yoshizumi's name in their names.

sen.e: Sumimoto HOSOKAWA
